page.title: 07JENKYN PLACE, BENTLEY
page.content: {Famous garden belonging to Gerald Coke {and his wife Patricia.}Created by them since 1945 it houses a plantsman's collection of shrubs, old roses, magnolias and rare and half-hardy specimens. On the east side is a cedar tree planted in 1826, and in the Lion Garden a fossil tree, Metasequoia Glyptostroboides, these together with magnificent herbaceaous borders make it a well visited garden.{The house} {dates from 1687,}two leaded casements remain on the east elevation, with the bulk being much altered it retains a predominantly 17th century appearance. {Jankenes Well, mentioned in Domesday {Book,}standing on the Pilgrim's Way, is to be found in the garden.{Open for {charities on various summer days, the {garden}attracts several thousand visitors each year.{The house is not {open to the public.
